data_table.description: Mild Dementia Plus, Original and Offspring Cohorts where cases were reviewed through 12/2012. Variables includes dementia status (at least mild), dementia subtype (classified with Alzheimer's disease and stroke), date known to be cognitively intact and date of incident dementia, death or censoring. Dementia was defined using DSM-IV criteria. The Epidemiology of Dementia Study has tracked incident cases of dementia in the Framingham cohort. Although not formally initiated until 1986, the initial baseline dementia-free Original cohort was determined from 1976-1978. Tracking for incident dementia in the Offspring cohort also began in 1976 and subjects have had serial MMSE since 1991. Participants whose performance on the MMSE drops 5 or more points across multiple examinations or 3 or more points from the previous examination or who are referred b themselves, their family, a physician from the community or from a FHS ancillary study examination, are flagged for a follow-up neurological and neuropsychological evaluation. Those found to be cognitive impaired by either evaluation are brought to a diagnostic consensus meeting to determine if dementia is evident, and if so, what subtype. Additional information about disease progression (when applicable) is also recorded.

variable.name: type
variable.comment: Blank = Dementia status, at least mild = No
variable.value: Mixed dementia: Alzheimer's disease and vascular dementia
Vascular dementia with no Alzheimer's disease
Neither Alzheimer's disease nor vascular dementia

variable.name: entry_date
variable.description: Date of entry into the "Dementia Mild Plus Incidence" cohort
variable.comment: ENTRY_DATE is formatted MMDDYYYY. For display purposes, only month and year are listed. For SHARe - ENTRY_DATE is number of days since exam 1, do not format as a date. Number of days since Exam 1.

variable.name: survdate
variable.description: Date of incident dementia, death, or censoring
variable.comment: SURVDATE is formatted MMDDYYYY. For display purposes, only month and year are listed. If the month was known, but the day was not, the 15th was used. If the year was known, but the month and day were not, then June 30th was used. This logic was used for event dates only, this does not apply to censoring dates or dates of death. For SHARe - SURV_DATE is number of days since exam 1, do not format as a date.
